MajorClaims.MC1: young adults should live with their parents for a longer period of time
MajorClaims.MC2: to cope with the physiological and psychological changes of adult life, to make financial life a less struggle and to prevent oneself digress from their destined path, it is important for young adults to live with their parents for a longer period of time

Claims.C1: living with parents is a wise choice for adults until they get a head start to their professional career with a reasonable income
Claims.C2: Another advantage of living with parents for a longer period of time is the enhanced emotional attachment with them
Claims.C3: young adults living with parents will not be free to do what they want
Claims.C4: young adults should only consider living on their own only after they are sure they could sustain on their own

Premises.P1: Living on your own is a huge financial commitment
Premises.P2: At younger age people are less likely to get a high paying job
Premises.P3: It can be a difficult task to pay for rent, food, utilities and other expenses to sustain yourself
Premises.P4: Parents have valuable advice to their children as they go through the changes in their adult life
Premises.P5: Living together develops the environment of discussing adult's physiological and psychological changes face to face with their parents
Premises.P6: Young adults will feel reluctant to discuss such problems with their parents if they move out and live on their own, and thus missing the valuable input of their parents
Premises.P7: most young adults are inclined to take unprecedented advantages of the freedom they have
Premises.P8: It is good thing if living with parents does not give freedom for young people to party all night, smoke or do drugs
Premises.P9: It is unwise to trade the opportunity of living with parents for a longer period of time for some late night parties or drugs
